author: palladia
body: Also make it user-customizable with $host variable. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/powershell/powershell/863)

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
That's a great functionality, but it's presented in PSReadLine.

On the last Open PS meeting the agreement was that we don't developing features in the CoreConsoleHost, but porting PSReadLine to CoreCLR and Linux.

If we proceed with this plan, it's a throw-away work.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Why would this not be a part of the host itself? If the user doesn't explicitly download and install PSReadline, they won't have history? That's... bad UX.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: we ship PSReadLine in-box in Windows, why not we do the same for PowerShell Core?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: AFAIK PSReadline is _not_ shipped in-box on Windows. Did that change? I think it would certainly be better to ship it in-box.

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
It was snipped in-box in Windows 10 first time. It's also a part of WMF 5 for down-level systems.
It supports update from PSGallery, so people can upgrade their in-box version.

My understanding was that we are going to include the ported version in PowerShell package.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Sorry for the unmerged work @palladia, but it sounded like the consensus was to only support PSReadline history.
